content.raw: We use hx_last_result in the C API because the functions return a non-informative hxERROR.  But in MATLAB we print the error text in the user workspace whenever there is an error (or at least that is what I am doing -- what do you print?) so hx_last_result will not provide any new information; it will just be the same error message the user already got.  Which is why I don't think we need hx_last_result in the MATLAB API.
content.html: We use hx_last_result in the C API because the functions return a non-informative hxERROR. But in MATLAB we print the error text in the user workspace whenever there is an error (or at least that is what I am doing -- what do you print?) so hx_last_result will not provide any new information; it will just be the same error message the user already got. Which is why I don't think we need hx_last_result in the MATLAB API.
